content.html: Every now and then, since we were kids, Vic and I would come up with web projects to impulsively build in a day, just for the fun of it. Now that I think about it, it feels odd and miraculous that a blog focused on football hasn’t happened until now. Miraculous as getting Football Manager 2010 running on modern hardware.

Is it ever a good idea to install any Football Manager game at all? Well, I guess we’ll see. I mostly blame Vic’s convincing skills, but also... Luka Modrić. That farewell day at the Bernabéu a few months ago surely wrecked me. Maybe now I just want to look back at a time when players were older than us.

I’ll leave the thrills of starting small to Vic’s Girondins. My real interest now is in reuniting with that 09/10 Real Madrid squad and seeing if things can play out differently in Florentino’s big return season. At the very least I should be able to avoid the Alcorconazo... and maybe break the Round of 16 curse a bit earlier?
It’s 2009 again: FM’s UI is beautiful, and we all know where the Champions League final is going to be played.
